channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Private hospitals ask Duterte to fire Duque
item.description: The Private Hospitals Association of the Philippines Inc. said its 744 member-hospitals feel it's time for the health chief to go.

item.title: Palace on possible Duque exit: If he is still there, Duterte still trusts him
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Asked to react to the report, presidential spokesman Harry Roque said he does not know anything about the newspaper article.

item.title: Fuel subsidies, new bus system among DOTr plans for 'new normal' transportation
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: Besides the current health and safety protocols for all public vehicles, the transportation department disclosed its plans of subsidizing fuel and transforming the current buses plying the Metro's main thoroughfare included in its stimulus package for public transportation as part of its novel coronavirus (COVID-19) response.

item.title: SWS: Majority of Filipinos wear masks, keep physical distance to prevent spread of COVID-19
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: In a survey of 4,010 respondents, SWS found that 77% of working-age Filipinos or those aged 15 years old and above always use a face mask when going out of their homes. Only 2% said they rarely don face coverings once outside.

item.title: Confirmed COVID-19 cases in Philippines now at 14,319
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Some 345,104 people have died out of more than 5.4 million confirmed COVID-19 infections worldwide.

item.title: Majority of Metro Manila mayors in favor of shift to GCQ, council chair says
item.description: “The economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic in Metro Manila alone is horrible and horrifying,” he said earlier.

item.title: Online child sexual exploitation in the Philippines nearly tripled during quarantine — DOJ
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "We are confident that ISPs will voluntarily comply with the law requiring them to install technology that will block or filter out materials that exploit children," Justice Undersecretary Markk Perete told reporters in a statement.

item.title: Palace says target capacity of 30,000 daily coronavirus tests met
item.description: Data from the DOH showed that only 8,179 samples were tested on May 20.

item.title: Group calls for transparency in jail reports as coronavirus hits Philippine prisons
item.description: KAPATID, a support group formed by relatives and friends of political prisoners, stressed real-time reports on jail condition are critical in saving the lives of thousands of prisoners.

item.title: Life After Lockdown: Move to digital a huge trial for courtrooms, law enforcement agencies
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has forced the world to adopt new ways of living and conducting business, but the reduced physical interactions do not mean essential institutions like the legal and justice system can stop working.
